Description: Papyrus; Hieratic administrative text verso; magical/medical text recto. Recto contains 4 incantations to be used against snakes. Originally part of the same roll as EA 9997, although no direct join between the two now survives.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (Findspot determined by content.)
Curator's comments: Published: Cerny J. Notebooks. Mss. In Griffith Institute, Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. http://www.griffith.ox.ac.uk/gri/4cerny.html Kitchen, Ram. Insc. Vol 7 pp. 389-394 BM OP 60, p.17 plate a and e H.W. Fischer-Elfert, Magika Hieratika in Berlin, Hannover, Heidelberg und München (AOP 2). Berlin, 2015, 96-101, for a parallel magical text in Berlin. R. Demarée, A Late New Kingdom Administrative Miscellany on the verso of a Magical Papyrus in the British Museum. Preliminary notes. In: U. Verhoven, Ägyptologische “Binsen” Weisheiten I-II. Neue Forschungen und Methoden der Hieratistik. Akademie der Wissenschaften und der Literatur, Mainz. Franz Steiner Verlag, Stuttgart, 2015. Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 103, 215.
See J. Quack, 'Beitraege zu einigen religioesen und magischen Texte', in M. Collier and S. Snape (ed.), Ramesside Studies in Honour of K. A. Kitchen (Bolton 2011), 414 [on 2.16].
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381186) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381186)
Leitz 1999 / Magical and Medical papyri of the New Kingdom (pp.3-30, pl. 9-11)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss Black ink Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
